The Commercial Manager is responsible for the commercial aspects of all shops/agents within a country controlling Minimum Control Standards (MCS), increasing sales through best working practices, monitoring P&L to maximize sales and minimize loss, ensure total compliance with Company Standard Operating Procedures and all franchise/agent agreement articles. 
Principal account abilities include, but not limit to:
 Reviews/analyses sales, finds reasons for increase/decrease, and writes an action plan on how to improve.  Studies a MCS for each shop and elaborates a plan with a calendar.  Reviews all training records and plans a monthly training calendar.  Ensures that all managers & staff are trained to the required standards, providing appropriate training & development plans for all and ensuring completion.  Conducts appraisals for managers with regularly meeting with them to set common goals, and delegates key tasks to them to maximize their potentials.  Follows up closely on staff performance and productivity  Maintains excellent communications with shop managers, and healthy relations with superiors discussing with them any pending issues related to the operation.  Completes daily, weekly & monthly schedule of tasks, activities, programs and initiatives.  Follows up on customer complaints and collects feedback.  Maintains adherence to company standards and policies at all times.  Sets a challenge for shop managers/agents to increase sales/reduce costs.  Spot checks visits for inventory count approved products used and sold, looks for any discrepancies and takes corrective action when needed.  Creating awareness and developing the sales network.  Draft marketing budgets and executing it after being approved liaising with operations manager.  Ensuring all outlets are setup in good conditions and products are always running.  Submits monthly and quarterly reports for sales/margin performance.  Motivating and supporting store managers with specific issues, such as staffing and business management.  Sets ideal staff count v Actual and works on recruiting suitable staff.  Performs other duties pertinent to the position job as assigned by line manager.  Communication & Working Relationships  Works closely with store managers and operations manager to ensure the consistent implementation of company standards  Coordinates with different departments in head office to guarantee effective communication  Interacts with customers to follow-up on their satisfaction, requests, and complaints  Manages direct reports and operational issues on a daily basis  
Desired Skills and Experience:  Bachelor degree in any field.  Excellent operations knowledge of retail or hospitality.  Skills in managing people, setting goals/targets, excellent interpersonal and communication skills.  Excellent oral and written English and/or French  Advanced computer skills, especially in Microsoft Office Applications.  Leadership, strong Personality and Charisma.  The position of the CM may require long hours, working/living in challenging environments, regular shop visits and flexibility. The duties listed above are not definitive.  
Benefits:  Competitive salary  Accommodation  Discretionary Bonus  Return flights
column12:
Editec UK is a leading sports betting, lottery and gaming operator in Africa with a strong presence in 20 countries and management satellite offices across Europe and the Middle East. The retail division operates under renowned brands of Premier Bet, SBA, Mercury International, Guinée Games and R&S Betting.
 
The gaming industry is one of the fastest growing sectors in Africa, creating sustainable jobs and generating new sources of wealth and revenue in the developing markets. The people of Editec are experienced professionals, passionate and committed to working together to develop maintainable and responsible gaming activities throughout the continent.

Editec’s fundamental strategy is to strengthen its presence globally through developing unique online gaming platforms, providing the most efficient payment solutions and offering the largest variety of games to its customers. We constantly strive for excellence in performance, technology and creativity. 

Editec hires directly 330 employees and consultants who are unique individuals and excel in their roles of establishing and growing the business in the face of challenges encountered in the emerging markets. We are shaping regulations through partnerships with governments, positively managing currency fluctuations and political, economic and social uncertainties.

column7:
Job Description

To deliver Regional sales and organization objectives through effective leadership and management of the Franchise team.
To ensure resources are used in an optimal manner and the Franchise does not exceed agreed expenditure budgets.
To devise long term strategy for the Franchise’s product portfolio and fit of organization with market/customer requirements.
To contribute to the regional marketing long and short term strategy in terms of allocating resources, portfolio priorities and organization change.
To oversee the effective implementation of the regional marketing plan in relation to key marketing programs critical to the success of the product.
To ensure that plans accommodate changes taking place with regard to product strategy and the external environment
To manage the Strategic Sales and Operational plan through the Country Operations Heads.
To ensure that the sales team identify the success factors necessary to deliver the marketing plans and develop appropriate monitor and control mechanisms, rewards and incentives.
To review of the optimal structure and deployment of the sales teams and ensure that appropriate training and development programs are developed and implemented to ensure that the skills and capabilities of the sales teams remain competitive.
To handle along with Country sales and marketing managers for setting performance management objectives based on marketing, sales and medical plans and assessment of individual performance vs. objectives.
To handle for the effective leadership, management, coaching and counseling of cross –country, multi-disciplinary Franchise team.
To conduct training needs analysis and personal development of direct reports.
To ensure that effective working relationships are in place across the multi-disciplinary team within the function and cross function at a regional level to obtain input to plans/ programs and ownership to implement plans as required.
To motivate all relevant personnel within and across functions through communication of the Franchises vision, clarity of direction and leading by example

Minimum Requirements
 University degree in Science and /or degree in Business. MBA preferred 10-12 years sales & marketing experience within pharmaceutical industry, including 5 years in management position Strong leadership skills Well-developed planning and resource allocation skills Strong communication and negotiation skills Good analytical skills Adept at collaborating within a matrix environment Candidate can be based in any of the Levant countries and should be willing to travel frequently

Novartis products reach nearly 1 billion people globally and we are finding innovative ways to expand access to our latest treatments. About 125 000 people of more than 140 nationalities work at Novartis around the world.

Créé en 1986, le Groupe Acteos propose des solutions modulaires et intégrées d´optimisation des flux logistiques. Ces solutions à haute valeur ajoutée sont bâties sur le temps réel, l’anticipation, et l’aide à la décision. 

Concepteur, éditeur et intégrateur de logiciels en Supply Chain Planning & Execution, Acteos offre une gamme innovatrice de solutions permettant à ses clients de maîtriser leurs stocks tout au long de la chaîne logistique. column7:
Location: Beirut Job description 
  CX Applications Sales Representative 
 
  We are looking for Applications Sales Representatives  in Lebanon for Customer Experience   ·Are you driven to be successful? ·Does your curiosity lead you down new paths? ·Do you embrace change? ·Do you see Cloud Applications as your future?   …if so, we want to talk to you!  If you are looking to take the next step in your career working for a company whose applications infrastructure is used for cancer research, crime prevention and many more other exciting ways of improving the quality of life, let’s talk!   In this role you will be responsible for selling Oracle’s next generation of Cloud Applications.   What does that mean?   ·         You are a self-starter, You are customer focused ·         You are smart, social media savvy, digitally responsive ·         As an Applications Sales Representative, you will engage with prospect organizations to position Oracle’s Cloud solutions through Challenger based selling, business case creation, Customer references and analyst data ·         You are the owner of your territory and customer relationships ·         You have customer success as your top priority ·         You manage the end to end sales process through engagement of appropriate resources such as Pre Sales experts, Oracle Consulting Services, Oracle’s Executives and our global Partner network ·         You generate short term results as well as maintaining a long term perspective for your accounts in your territory to maximize revenue generation ·         You will ensure daily update of the Oracle Sales Cloud with accurate customer and pipeline data     We can accelerate your career by combining your potential and skills with the training that Oracle provides to become an outstanding sales representative and partner to our customers.   Our customers are central to everything we do at Oracle, so we are keen to hear from people who see customer success as their top priority. We value effective communicators and strong team players who can understand the needs of senior level decision makers. Our sales representatives build credible relationships with multiple customer stakeholders, recognize their business and industry challenges and demonstrate value to them. We seek self motivated individuals who thrive on change and problem solving. Everyday is different at Oracle and we are looking for people who enjoy innovating and working in an agile environment.   Some travel may be required for face to face customer visits and that you would need to be eligible to work in the country of hire and need to be fluent in English and Arabic.

column7:
JOB PURPOSE 

To work with the Sr Director of GR to manage the development and implementation of an effective government relations, regulatory and policy strategy for Levant to enhance the company’s current business and operations, regulatory and fiscal treatment, whilst enabling the development and growth of new products and services.

JOB DIMENSIONS

This role has significant impact on key operational metrics including, quite simply, the company’s ability to generate and grow revenue in Levant through existing and future products, services, and operations.

Key Responsibilities
 Develop and implement Government Relations Country Strategy and Engagement Plan Build compelling advocacy positions for the company’s existing products and next products and services Build team to implement delivery of strategy and engagement plan Develop and maintain key relationships with line Ministries, regulator(s), and other Government and non-government stakeholders at Minister, DM, CEO, VP levels Establish and advocate on policy positions and arguments to advance company’s regulatory and policy objectives – thought leadership on country policy Manage company compliance and reporting requirements in line with existing sector regulations and contractual obligations Mitigate risk on compliance related issues Work on ride-hailing, delivery and potentially payments based regulatory frameworks 

Key Requirements
 10+ years of post graduate experience  A diverse range of backgrounds could be the foundation for success in such a role including having worked in public policy, government, public affairs or relations, regulated environments, management consulting, or law Comfort with starting from positions of regulatory uncertainty Attention to detail, ability to think creatively, stay very calm, establish positions that benefit the company and its government partners, and advocate compellingly. Fluency in Arabic and English

column12:
As a leading international franchise operator, with nearly 90 of the world’s most recognised brands in its portfolio, Alshaya Group brings great shopping, dining, leisure and hospitality experiences to millions of customers across the Middle East & North Africa, Russia, Turkey, Europe and beyond. 

Alshaya Group is a dynamic multinational business and family owned enterprise with a consistent record of growth and innovation. For 35 years, Alshaya has been a pioneering force in brand franchising, using its exceptional knowledge and experience to expand at pace.

Our portfolio of well-loved international brands includes Starbucks, H&M, Mothercare, Debenhams, American Eagle Outfitters, P.F. Chang’s, The Cheesecake Factory, The Body Shop, M.A.C, Victoria’s Secret, Boots, Pottery Barn, KidZania and, coming soon, Hampton by Hilton.

From one retail franchise store opened in Kuwait in 1983, Alshaya Group has consistently grown and diversified and today offers customers an unparalleled choice of brands across multiple sectors; Fashion & Footwear, Health & Beauty, Food, Optics, Pharmacy, Home Furnishings, Leisure & Entertainment, and Hotels. A diverse, skilled team of 53,000 people from 120 nationalities support more than 4,000 stores, cafes, restaurants and leisure destinations, a growing online business and a commitment to delivering great customer experiences.

Description

To effectively represent and promote Boehringer Ingelheim (BI) core products to existing and potential customers, by presenting how BI products benefits their patients, with the objective of maximizing sales revenue and increasing market share, also To offer innovative, tailored solutions for key accounts ensuring long term presence of the Specialty portfolio whilst adhering to best practice principles and BI's standard operational procedures (SOPs).

Responsibilities
  Builds and executes an effective Sales Action Plan with the objective of maximizing BI business in assigned accounts and to ensure achievement of sales and market share targets/objectives   Monitors the sales development and performance of BI Specialty products.   Plans and schedules daily visits with existing and potential customers to deliver BI’s assigned core product message   Records and tracks product sales and customers in his/her region   Obtains and records feedback from existing customer on competitors product performance and monitors their activity   Secures consistent and sustainable growth in sales and revenue by identifying and developing new market opportunities.   Precise & full understanding and utilization of medical knowledge about therapeutic area and related products.   Obtain and provide information about the development in accounts on their purchasing medicines and developments regarding to healthcare projects.   Listing of Specialty products in all accounts through the value proposition of Specialty products to the payers and P&T committee and the decision makers.   Set the optimum price per account, through direct bonus or any other alternative price strategy, to ensure listing BI oncology portfolio within the accounts.   Monitor the competition intelligence activities on Key Accounts.   Achieve or exceed overall sales targets via appropriate resource utilization as well as routine and frequent visits to key stakeholders as chief pharmacists; decision makers; and related physicians   Update a OTSW analysis to be translated in to quantitative and qualitative objective for the assigned accounts.   Build strong and long partnership with all Key stakeholders and Ensure their full awareness of BI product benefits to the patients.   Propose customized partnership programs for both prescriber and payers that needs to build the productive business relation between the account and BI. 

Requirements
  Bachelor's degree in Pharmacy.   Based in Lebanon.   Minimum 3 to 4 years of Pharmaceutical Sales experience.   Respiratory or Oncology experience is a must.   Profound communication and Presentation skills.   Language skills: Fluency in English. 

Job

Sales

Primary Location

Africa, Asia, Australasia-LB-Beirut-Beirut

Organization

EG-Boehringer Ingelheim Egypt

Schedule

Full-time
column12: For more than 130 years, Boehringer Ingelheim has been committed to the research, development, and manufacturing of new medications with high therapeutic value for people and animals. As a family-owned pharmaceutical company, Boehringer Ingelheim is able to take a long-term view and invest heavily in research and development. We are proud of addressing some of the most challenging healthcare issues. Our vision – value through innovation – has always characterized our collaborative work, and is for us simultaneously a fundamental requirement and a driving force. Headquartered in Ingelheim, Germany, Boehringer Ingelheim employs more than 50,000 employees. For more information please visit www.boehringer-ingelheim.com

column7:
MISSION AND SCOPE  You are a key member of the EMEA Internal Audit team and operate from our office in Lebanon. As Senior Internal Auditor you serve as project leader on internal audits or play a lead role in completing complex components of large-scale audit projects. You will support the EMEA Audit Manager to identify risk-based audits for the Middle-East and support audit projects in Europe, Middle-East and Africa. You are skilled in assessing complex business domains, identifying relevant internal control issues and making value-add recommendations. You have excellent interpersonal and intercultural skills and are ready to travel in the Middle-East and in Europe.  
YOUR JOB  Act as the first point of contact for Middle-East business partners and assist in the identification of key business risks for the Middle-East region to propose risk-based audit plans.  Lead financial, operational and compliance audits utilizing independent judgment and discretion  Determine scope of review in conjunction with the Audit Manager.  Support the creation of risk-based audit programs.  Assess risks and evaluate the business procedures and controls designed to mitigate those risks.  Conduct audit testing of specified areas and identify reportable issues and dimension of risk.  Verbally communicate findings to senior management and draft a comprehensive and complete report of the audited area.  Supervise and coach junior team members or guest auditors on audit assignments.  Perform ongoing follow-up on action plan implementation and timeliness of remedial actions.  Conduct periodic business partner meetings and participate to risk and compliance related forums.  Work with systems development project teams to ensure projects are implemented successfully.  Actively support the continuous improvement of internal audit practices, methodologies and tools.     Qualifications   ·         Master’s degree in Economics, Accounting, Finance or related field. CA/CPA or CIA certification is a plus.  ·         Minimum 5 years of professional experience, preferably in Big 4 public accounting firm or as internal auditor in the insurance sector.  ·         In-depth understanding of accounting principles, control procedures and audit standards, practices and techniques. CAATs knowledge is desirable.  ·         Possess excellent oral and written communication skills. Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to present at all levels of the organization.  ·         Proven ability to build effective relationships with business partners globally. Cross-cultural agility and sensitivity.  ·         Ability to think analytically, interpret information/observations, apply judgment and make effective decisions. Innovative and able to challenge the conventional ways of doing things.  ·         Able to multi-task and adapt quickly to change. Strong organizational agility and results driven.  ·         Comfortable working in both an office-based and virtual team-based collaborative environment.  ·         Willingness to travel 30 percent of the time. Comfortable working in multicultural environments.  ·         Unquestionable ethics and integrity.

column7:
PN 398690

OBJECTIVES OF THE PROGRAMME
The objective of WHO NCD/Mental Health programme is to reduce mortality and morbidity through increasing access to quality health care services. The main focus of the programme will be on strengthening the health system in Lebanon and supporting the health sector recovery and transition.

Description Of Duties

The incumbent will perform the following duties:1. Provide technical advice to NMH related national health staff with regards to ensure that NMH activities are implemented in accordance with WHO policy and internationally recognized standards.2. Coordinate workshops, seminars and meetings for all NMH related program at the national level.3. Coordinate with the local NMH managers from the zone to ensure the quality of training programs at local and zonal level to maximise the health staff skills.4. Manage the logistics and storage of the supplies needed in the delivery of NCD prevention and control and mental health services in collaboration with medical storekeeper and logistic staff.5. Provide quarterly situation reports on progress, achievements and constraints.6. Identify opportunities for potential partnerships at local level for NMH program support with UN agencies, international and national NGOs.7. Constantly monitor NMH needs in the zone and propose appropriate action in collaboration with UN agencies, International and National NGOs in order to achieve NMH objectives.

Required Qualifications

Education
Essential: University degree in medicine or public health.
Desirable: Masters' degree in public health

Experience

Essential: At least 2 years of relevant experience in NCD prevention and management and mental health. Experience in working with local community and National authorities.
Desirable: Work experience with UN system or international non-governmental organizations. Experience in developing countries.

Skills

Thorough knowledge of principles and programs of NMH and its management- Sound skills in working with local community in particular rural level in setting priorities and development of action plans- Proven skills in setting up of health priority programs in complex emergency situations and difficult circumstances primarily focusing on NCDs and mental health- Ability to prioritize, organize, manage and adapt management style according to needs- Ability to work under pressure

WHO Competencies

WHO global Competencies model at http://www.who.int/employment/WHO_competencies_EN.pdf?ua=1

 Teamwork Respecting and promoting individual and cultural differences Communication Producing results

Use of Language Skills
Essential: Expert knowledge of English. Expert knowledge of Arabic.
Desirable: Intermediate knowledge of French.

REMUNERATION
Remuneration comprises an annual base salary starting at LBP 96,699,000 (subject to mandatory deductions for pension contributions and health insurance, as applicable) and 30 days of annual leave.

Additional Information
 This vacancy notice may be used to fill other similar positions at the same grade level  Only candidates under serious consideration will be contacted.  A written test may be used as a form of screening.  In the event that your candidature is retained for an interview, you will be required to provide, in advance, a scanned copy of the degree(s)/diploma(s)/certificate(s) required for this position. WHO only considers higher educational qualifications obtained from an institution accredited/recognized in the World Higher Education Database (WHED), a list updated by the International Association of Universities (IAU)/United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO). The list can be accessed through the link: http://www.whed.net/. Some professional certificates may not appear in the WHED and will require individual review.  Any appointment/extension of appointment is subject to WHO Staff Regulations, Staff Rules and Manual.  For information on WHO's operations please visit: http://www.who.int.  WHO is committed to workforce diversity.  WHO has a smoke-free environment and does not recruit smokers or users of any form of tobacco.  This is a National Professional Officer position. Therefore, only applications from nationals of the country where the duty station is located will be accepted. Applicants who are not nationals of this country will not be considered.

Grade

NO-B

Contractual Arrangement

Temporary appointment under Staff Rule 420.4

Contract duration

12 months

Job Posting

Oct 25, 2018, 9:19:17 AM

Closing Date

Nov 14, 2018, 11:59:00 PM

Primary Location

Lebanon-Beirut

Organization

EM_LEB WHO Representative's Office, Lebanon
IMPORTANT NOTICE: Please note that the deadline for receipt of applications indicated above reflects your personal device's system settings.

Job Title: 
 Medical Representative – Beirut Area     Job Summary: 
 Planning and conducting appointments with doctors and medical professionals to promote Hikma products with the aim to achieve the overall sales target while monitoring competitor’s activities and threats. Following up on and reviewing Hikma products’ performance within the market through clients responses and other indicators.     Responsibilities:   Visiting doctors in private clinics or hospitals to promote products, disseminate information and convey company messages to achieve monthly sales target.  Conducting conferences and lectures on Hikma products while developing contacts effectively  Providing clients with technical information about Hikma products including price, side effects, value…etc  Forging relationships with doctors, medical professionals and other clients, while maintaining current relationships  Following up on and reviewing Hikma products’ performance within the market through clients’ responses and other indicators  Documenting all sales related activities performed in a timely manner  Generating the needed reports including business intelligence reports, market survey reports, competitors’ activities reports, events feedback reports    Collating accurate and prompt basic sales information and entering them on the CRM system      Requirements:   BS degree in Pharmacy  1 to 3 years’ experience in pharmaceutical sales
column12:
Hikma is a multinational pharmaceutical group dedicated to improving the health and wellbeing of people in the markets it serves through the development, manufacturing and marketing of a broad range of solid, liquid and injectable generic and in-licensed pharmaceutical products.

Hikma is a leading generic pharmaceutical company with a significant presence in the Middle East and North Africa (MENA) region, the United States and Europe. It was first listed on the London Stock Exchange in 2005 is now a constituent of the FTSE 100 Index.

Disclaimer:

EMPLOYMENT RECRUITMENT FRAUD ALERT

Please be advised that the Hikma Pharmaceuticals Group does not ask its employees or prospective employees to wire any money either to its bank accounts or to any third party, and does not conduct employment interviews via any social media platform, Google Hangouts, Yahoo! Messenger, text message, or e-mail. Unfortunately, employment scams are increasingly common and it is important to remain vigilant when conducting a job search. For more information about these scams, see the UK National Fraud Intelligence Bureau’s website and the US Better Business Bureau’s article on the subject.

If you receive a request to send money through any means or a request for personal information from anyone claiming to be a Hikma recruiter, DO NOT REPLY. Instead, please forward the communication(s) to us at vacancy@hikma.com so that we may provide it to relevant law enforcement agencies, as appropriate.

To provide vision and management to the IT department. Manages and coordinates company's IT function including application development, infrastructure development, user support and data management to meet company’s business requirements. Candidate must hold a CCE degree with  not less than 10 years of experience. Experience in Navision system is mandatory  
Duties: To supervise IT-based operations and services to meet IT requirements. To support short and long-term business needs. To ensure the development and maintenance of business application systems. To oversee the implementation of an assigned technology as well as the integration and performance of all local area networks for the organization. To perform ERP new implementation, and training for all group subsidiaries. To analyze developments in Internet technology. To develop, implement and support desktop computing and networking standards and procedures to simplify network environment and troubleshooting (WAN, LAN, VPN tunnels, Security, Cost…etc.) To introduce / upgrade/ maintain different systems within the group (Mail System, Internet Systems, Archive Servers, File Servers, backup servers, Intranet, Websites, Domain names registration and protection…etc.). To research, negotiate, and institute standard server configuration for remote sites, achieving a large cost savings while establishing a corporate-wide server standard. To audit and control users for unauthorized use of companies’ assets and resources. To meet suppliers and service providers for new tech and offers. To communicate with the HODs and plan for new projects as per their need. To set annual targets related to IT operations and monitor the overall performance of the entire department. To oversee the development, design, and implementation of new applications and changes to existing computer systems and software packages. Responsible for the ordering, acquisition, inventorying, and disposition of hardware and software. To serve as primary contact with outside vendors in the generation of RFPs, bids, contracts, agreements, and other major vendor interactions, Systems Operations and maintenance.  To assign budget constraints. To maintain security and privacy of the information systems, communication lines, and equipment. To develop, review, and certify all back-up and disaster recovery procedures and plans.  To manage, motivate and assess performance of the IT team. To provide day-to-day supervision.  To visit all branches from time to time to check end user needs and performance.

column7:
Job Description
 Maintain an accurate, complete, up-to-date and insightful client business profiles to be shared with senior management. Drive client satisfaction by providing insights and actionable recommendations during presentations or business reviews and also by providing value-added analyses and response
to special requests.
 Undertake sales activities independently or in conjunction with senior staff in terms of preparation and delivery of proposal and credentials. Ensure the generation of required revenue from the assigned client portfolio and proper contract costing in order to meet the agreed budget targets. Identify and recommend enhanced and new services that answer clients' business needs. Build and maintain ongoing relationships with the identified key persons within client organization.
Knowledge And Skills Required
 Strong Client Focus Understand marketing enough to hold meaningful conversations with client’s marketing &
business teams.
 Knowledge of statistics and multivariate analysis Expert knowledge of research techniques and methodologies Proactive Able to influence and persuade. Strong customer service and interpersonal communication skills Ability to analyse and interpret data in a challenging and insightful manner Efficient time management, ability to multi-task and detail oriented Displays maturity and creative problem solving skills in handling crises Recommend improvements in work processes within area of responsibility Analyses and interprets financial information to ensure achievement of business targets and
early identification of issues / crisis.
 Able to operate in a multi-cultural environment
Qualifications
 4 to 6 years’ experience and Proven success with primary research. Post-Graduation from a premier institute. Good analysis skills and insight generation. Good grounding in custom research principles, methodologies, statistical techniques. Basic business understanding (e.g. comfortable with terminology: revenue, profit, loss, margin). Excellent PowerPoint and Excel skills or Google Slides and Google Sheets.
Nielsen Holdings plc (NYSE: NLSN) is a global performance management company that provides a comprehensive understanding of what consumers watch and buy. Nielsen’s Watch segment provides media and advertising clients with Nielsen Total Audience measurement services for all devices on which content — video, audio and text — is consumed. The Buy segment offers consumer packaged goods manufacturers and retailers the industry’s only global view of retail performance measurement. By integrating information from its Watch and Buy segments and other data sources, Nielsen also provides its clients with analytics that help improve performance. Nielsen, an S&P 500 company, has operations in over 100 countries, covering more than 90% of the world’s population. For more information, visit www.nielsen.com.

Nielsen’s Watch segment provides media and advertising clients with Total Audience measurement services across all devices where content — video, audio and text — is consumed. The Buy segment offers consumer packaged goods manufacturers and retailers the industry’s only global view of retail performance measurement. 

By integrating information from its Watch and Buy segments and other data sources, Nielsen provides its clients with both world-class measurement as well as analytics that help improve performance. Nielsen, an S&P 500 company, has operations in over 100 countries that cover more than 90 percent of the world’s population. 

For more information, visit www.nielsen.com.

column7:
Job Description

Position : Mechanical Technician 

Organization 
 Function : Maintenance Country : Lebanon Location : Nahr Ibrahim Supervisor : Mechanical Head 

Context 

The Maintenance Technician is responsible for the equipments performance and availability within his own field of expertise and perimeter. He is the key technical contact within his field and proposes solutions to improve equipments. He applies safety,environment and prevention standards within his work area.

Areas of responsibility

Perform Maintenance

 Makes failures diagnosis and helps maintenance operators in solving complex breakdowns.Performs scheduled preventive maintenance. Contributes to new works projects (feasibility, monitoring of works).Takes corrective action to restore equipments.Produces intervention reports when the work is completed. Validates works end or progress with the production.

Monitoring of performance

 Knows all equipments Controls and checks equipment and ensures its conformity(availability, standard, safety). Optimizes equipment performance, the life of critical parts and overall maintenance costs. Monitors physical indicators to know the situation in his perimeter.Reports the achieved results in his perimeter.

Application of standards

Follows safety rules.Performs maintenance respecting production standards.Respects maintenance’s service and store’s management standards.Alerts on the dysfunctions and risks of damages.In case of deviation, brings equipment back up to standard.Identifies the degree or criticality of deviations from standards.Participates in safety incident analysis.

Makes standards evolve.

Required Skills And Qualifications
 BT/TS in mechanicall ( Technical level background ) Minimum 3 years experience in the mechanical maintenance field Good English / French
column12:
As a global leader in advanced cabling and connectivity solutions, Nexans brings energy to life through an extensive range of best-in-class products and innovative services. For over 120 years, innovation has been the company’s hallmark, enabling Nexans to drive a safer, smarter and more efficient future together with its customers. 

Today, the Nexans Group is committed to facilitating energy transition and supporting the exponential growth of data by empowering its customers in four main business areas: Building & Territories (including utilities, smart grids, e­mobility), High Voltage & Projects (covering offshore wind farms, submarine interconnections, land high voltage), Telecom & Data (covering data transmission, telecom networks, hyperscale data centers, LAN), and Industry & Solutions (including renewables, transportation, Oil & Gas, automation, and others). 

Corporate Social Responsibility is a guiding principle of Nexans’ business activities and internal practices. In 2013 Nexans became the first cable provider to create a Foundation supporting sustainable initiatives bringing access to energy to disadvantaged communities worldwide. The Group’s commitment to developing ethical, sustainable and high-quality cables drives its active involvement within several leading industry associations, including Europacable, The National Electrical Manufacturers Association (NEMA), International Cablemakers Federation (ICF) or CIGRE to mention a few. 

Nexans employs more than 26,000 people with industrial footprint in 34 countries and commercial activities worldwide. In 2017, the Group generated 6.4 billion euros in sales. Nexans is listed on Euronext Paris, compartment A.

column7:
The purpose of the Ethiopia Electronic Health Information System (e-HIS) project is to support the Federal Ministry of Health (FMOH) in strengthening and modernizing the national Health Information System of Ethiopia. The project will involve supporting the government of Ethiopia to develop and bring to scale priority electronic health information systems, instill a culture of data use, build capacity and governance for the improved HIS, and ensure integrated systems by fostering stakeholder collaboration.

QED is seeking a Knowledge Management & Communications Specialist for an anticipated USAID Ethiopia Health Information Systems (HIS) project. The expected purpose of the project is to improve the collection and use of high-quality routine information in the health sector and contribute to improved quality, efficiency and availability of primary health and nutrition services at all levels. He/She will be responsible for the leadership and in-country management of the project’s monitoring, evaluation and learning activities.

Work with technical staff across the project’s office to promote knowledge capture, dissemination, and utilization to promote program cohesion and internal/external communicationProvide Chief of Party with regular program updates and summaries on program successes for a wide audienceRecommend to the MEL Advisor best approaches to showcase program impact to USAID, local counterparts and the publicWork with MEL Advisor to capture and feature program successes in innovative and compelling waysWork with MEL Advisor and DCOP to draft regular program updates for USAID reporting (quarterly and annual reports)Train technical staff (as needed) on KM best practice and story-tellingResponsible for updating all communications tools and products (program brochures, newsletters, success stories, website, and social media platforms)Bachelor’s Degree in communications, knowledge management, international development, or relevant field.5-7 years of experience in designing, leading, and implementing KM Communication activities on complex development programs (USAID-funded preferred)3-5 years of experience with HMIS and medical/health data/indicatorsAbility to work and quickly adapt in a complex environmentAbility to respond to pressure and deliver quality products on-timeStrong communications and data visualization skillsDemonstrated experience using communications tools to demonstrate impactExcellent oral and written communication skillsStrong training, communications and personnel management skillsEthiopian national strongly preferredFluency in English is required; Fluency in Amharic is preferred
column9: Non-profit Organization Management, Management Consulting, Government Administration
column12:
QED Group works globally with the public and private sectors to improve their performance and manage results. Using a systems approach, we combine innovative and evidence-based solutions with organizational development to drive efficiencies. 

Leveraging our proven experience and unique capabilities, we make complex data insightful and actionable. We are experts in monitoring, evaluating, assessing and training across sectors, such as health, security, agriculture, economic growth, governance, and education.

QED offers uniquely integrated solutions in Monitoring and Evaluation , Assessment, Global Health Solutions, Sustainable Investing, Organizational Development, and Innovation & Data. We have worked in more than 95 countries, using an evidence-based and multi-disciplinary approach to help advance global development impact. Currently, we are operating in 43 countries.

Our key clients are:

- The United States Agency for International Development (USAID)
- The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)
- The U.S. Department of State (DOS)
- UK Department for International Development (DFID)
- The U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA)
- Organization of American States (OAS)
- United States Institute of Peace

column7:
PN 398690

OBJECTIVES OF THE PROGRAMME
The objective of WHO NCD/Mental Health programme is to reduce mortality and morbidity through increasing access to quality health care services. The main focus of the programme will be on strengthening the health system in Lebanon and supporting the health sector recovery and transition.

Description Of Duties

The incumbent will perform the following duties:1. Provide technical advice to NMH related national health staff with regards to ensure that NMH activities are implemented in accordance with WHO policy and internationally recognized standards.2. Coordinate workshops, seminars and meetings for all NMH related program at the national level.3. Coordinate with the local NMH managers from the zone to ensure the quality of training programs at local and zonal level to maximise the health staff skills.4. Manage the logistics and storage of the supplies needed in the delivery of NCD prevention and control and mental health services in collaboration with medical storekeeper and logistic staff.5. Provide quarterly situation reports on progress, achievements and constraints.6. Identify opportunities for potential partnerships at local level for NMH program support with UN agencies, international and national NGOs.7. Constantly monitor NMH needs in the zone and propose appropriate action in collaboration with UN agencies, International and National NGOs in order to achieve NMH objectives.

Required Qualifications

Education
Essential: University degree in medicine or public health.
Desirable: Masters' degree in public health

Experience

Essential: At least 2 years of relevant experience in NCD prevention and management and mental health. Experience in working with local community and National authorities.
Desirable: Work experience with UN system or international non-governmental organizations. Experience in developing countries.

Skills

Thorough knowledge of principles and programs of NMH and its management- Sound skills in working with local community in particular rural level in setting priorities and development of action plans- Proven skills in setting up of health priority programs in complex emergency situations and difficult circumstances primarily focusing on NCDs and mental health- Ability to prioritize, organize, manage and adapt management style according to needs- Ability to work under pressure

WHO Competencies

WHO global Competencies model at http://www.who.int/employment/WHO_competencies_EN.pdf?ua=1

 Teamwork Respecting and promoting individual and cultural differences Communication Producing results

Use of Language Skills
Essential: Expert knowledge of English. Expert knowledge of Arabic.
Desirable: Intermediate knowledge of French.

REMUNERATION
Remuneration comprises an annual base salary starting at LBP 96,699,000 (subject to mandatory deductions for pension contributions and health insurance, as applicable) and 30 days of annual leave.

Additional Information
 This vacancy notice may be used to fill other similar positions at the same grade level  Only candidates under serious consideration will be contacted.  A written test may be used as a form of screening.  In the event that your candidature is retained for an interview, you will be required to provide, in advance, a scanned copy of the degree(s)/diploma(s)/certificate(s) required for this position. WHO only considers higher educational qualifications obtained from an institution accredited/recognized in the World Higher Education Database (WHED), a list updated by the International Association of Universities (IAU)/United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO). The list can be accessed through the link: http://www.whed.net/. Some professional certificates may not appear in the WHED and will require individual review.  Any appointment/extension of appointment is subject to WHO Staff Regulations, Staff Rules and Manual.  For information on WHO's operations please visit: http://www.who.int.  WHO is committed to workforce diversity.  WHO has a smoke-free environment and does not recruit smokers or users of any form of tobacco.  This is a National Professional Officer position. Therefore, only applications from nationals of the country where the duty station is located will be accepted. Applicants who are not nationals of this country will not be considered.

Grade

NO-B

Contractual Arrangement

Temporary appointment under Staff Rule 420.4

Contract duration

12 months

Job Posting

Oct 25, 2018, 9:19:17 AM

Closing Date

Nov 14, 2018, 11:59:00 PM

Primary Location

Lebanon-Beirut

Organization

EM_LEB WHO Representative's Office, Lebanon
IMPORTANT NOTICE: Please note that the deadline for receipt of applications indicated above reflects your personal device's system settings.

column12:
As a leading international franchise operator, with nearly 90 of the world’s most recognised brands in its portfolio, Alshaya Group brings great shopping, dining, leisure and hospitality experiences to millions of customers across the Middle East & North Africa, Russia, Turkey, Europe and beyond. 

Alshaya Group is a dynamic multinational business and family owned enterprise with a consistent record of growth and innovation. For 35 years, Alshaya has been a pioneering force in brand franchising, using its exceptional knowledge and experience to expand at pace.

Our portfolio of well-loved international brands includes Starbucks, H&M, Mothercare, Debenhams, American Eagle Outfitters, P.F. Chang’s, The Cheesecake Factory, The Body Shop, M.A.C, Victoria’s Secret, Boots, Pottery Barn, KidZania and, coming soon, Hampton by Hilton.

From one retail franchise store opened in Kuwait in 1983, Alshaya Group has consistently grown and diversified and today offers customers an unparalleled choice of brands across multiple sectors; Fashion & Footwear, Health & Beauty, Food, Optics, Pharmacy, Home Furnishings, Leisure & Entertainment, and Hotels. A diverse, skilled team of 53,000 people from 120 nationalities support more than 4,000 stores, cafes, restaurants and leisure destinations, a growing online business and a commitment to delivering great customer experiences.

column7:
Responsibilities include:

• Primary function is collecting & identifying market need, and developing appropriate product roadmap, with prioritized feature set. 
• Work cross functionally across teams--engineering, data science, sales & marketing, as well as senior executives--to prioritize key features/functionality to deliver a winning product offering. 

• Act as a product owner and be closely involved in design, documentation and testing of features.

• Product champion when working with customers/prospects and key partners.

• Work with stakeholders to effectively capture requirements and opportunities

• Carry out product process from discovery, definition and all the way to release/learn phase

• Create personas and write robust user stories and acceptance criteria

• Effectively drive the prioritisation on sprint basis and drive roadmap.

• Clearly communicate product plans, objectives and progress against plans and KPIs to all stakeholders

• Integrate usability studies, research and market analysis into product requirements to enhance product quality

The successful individuals will feel comfortable within a fast paced, engaging, technology start up and will have the ability to work flexibly across a range of responsibilities.

This candidate will also possess:

•       Experience of delivering complex products in an agile environment.
•       Clear focus on customer needs and delivering product value to customers
•       Self starter and self motivated working with a cross functional team
•       Familiar with minimum viable product and build, measure learn techniques

There are excellent terms on offer.

column7:
Location: Beirut Job description 
  CX Applications Sales Representative 
 
  We are looking for Applications Sales Representatives  in Lebanon for Customer Experience   ·Are you driven to be successful? ·Does your curiosity lead you down new paths? ·Do you embrace change? ·Do you see Cloud Applications as your future?   …if so, we want to talk to you!  If you are looking to take the next step in your career working for a company whose applications infrastructure is used for cancer research, crime prevention and many more other exciting ways of improving the quality of life, let’s talk!   In this role you will be responsible for selling Oracle’s next generation of Cloud Applications.   What does that mean?   ·         You are a self-starter, You are customer focused ·         You are smart, social media savvy, digitally responsive ·         As an Applications Sales Representative, you will engage with prospect organizations to position Oracle’s Cloud solutions through Challenger based selling, business case creation, Customer references and analyst data ·         You are the owner of your territory and customer relationships ·         You have customer success as your top priority ·         You manage the end to end sales process through engagement of appropriate resources such as Pre Sales experts, Oracle Consulting Services, Oracle’s Executives and our global Partner network ·         You generate short term results as well as maintaining a long term perspective for your accounts in your territory to maximize revenue generation ·         You will ensure daily update of the Oracle Sales Cloud with accurate customer and pipeline data     We can accelerate your career by combining your potential and skills with the training that Oracle provides to become an outstanding sales representative and partner to our customers.   Our customers are central to everything we do at Oracle, so we are keen to hear from people who see customer success as their top priority. We value effective communicators and strong team players who can understand the needs of senior level decision makers. Our sales representatives build credible relationships with multiple customer stakeholders, recognize their business and industry challenges and demonstrate value to them. We seek self motivated individuals who thrive on change and problem solving. Everyday is different at Oracle and we are looking for people who enjoy innovating and working in an agile environment.   Some travel may be required for face to face customer visits and that you would need to be eligible to work in the country of hire and need to be fluent in English and Arabic.
column12: The Oracle Cloud offers complete SaaS application suites for ERP, HCM and CX, plus best-in-class database Platform as a Service (PaaS) and Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) from data centers throughout the Americas, Europe and Asia. For more information about Oracle (NYSE:ORCL), please visit us at oracle.com.

column7:
Job Description

 Company Overview 

As part of our continued growth, SAS Middle East are hiring for a Regional Senior Account Executive with strong technology solutions sales experience in the Middle East and/or Levant region.

Based from Lebanon, you will sell to customers and manage accounts across multiple industries in a regional territory that will include Lebanon, Jordan, Qatar and Kuwait.

Key Responsibilities
Generate sales for software, solutions and services into prospective customers & build strong pipeline.Work with other sales leaders to position and leverage sales opportunities to acquire, grow and retain customers within assigned territory.Fulfill wide range of requests for information from prospective customers. Qualifies level of opportunity and type of account.Prospect within a territory or account to uncover business needs.Implement aspects of territory and account management and development; identifies accounts with high "close" potential, qualifies, and forecast time frames to close business.Prepare standard quotations and proposal information as needed; works with other departments to create and finalize contracts and set time schedules for services.Follow up with customers to track satisfaction levels and to discover additional revenue opportunities.Develop a basic understanding of company pricing and licensing procedures.Plan and implements growth plans, including sales, consulting services, and education services.Responsible for achievement of Total Software Revenue Target (and services)Coordinate resources from sales and services staff for solution selling and promotes and reinforces Solutions Selling and Miller-Heiman concepts. Work in conjunction with the Strategic Pricing Group to negotiate contracts and bids.Directs complex sales opportunities, including implementation plans, which include the coordination of internal and/or external professional services.Deliver timely and accurate sales forecasts to management.

Experience Required

The position ideally suits somebody with 10+ years’ experience selling complex technology solutions (including software) to organizations in the Middle East and/or Levant region. You should have proven success selling to business functions (not just IT) and building and managing relationships with contacts up to C-Suite level.

Due to the geographic territory you will be required to travel extensively to meet with customers.

About SAS

SAS believes in the whole employee experience. Meaningful work. Empowerment to make a difference that changes people’s lives. Dynamic work environments that foster innovation. And an award-winning culture that makes it all possible. We believe great ideas can come from anywhere. Whether you're a university recruit, or an experienced professional ready for the next big challenge, SAS brings perks, passion, and the potential to grow. No limits.

Want to stay up to date on SAS culture, products and jobs? Follow us on LinkedIn

Role Purpose:   Financial reporting responsibility for the Middle East branches in UAE, Oman and Kuwait and the Head Office in Lebanon.  The principal responsibility will be processing and booking of transactions to prepare monthly management accounts for a number of entities within strict deadlines.  The individual in this role will also be responsible for quarterly and year end statutory reporting to the regulator and the ministry of Finance, .and Group reporting (under IFRS and US GAAP respectively)  Adhoc requests and preparation of monthly reconciliations on a timely and accurate basis.   
 Key Accountabilities and Performance Indicators   Preparation of monthly management accounts in accordance with US GAAP and strict reporting deadlines  Providing analysis and commentary on the monthly results to senior Finance  Preparation of monthly balance sheet reconciliations for all accounts in line with US SARBOX requirements  Review of manual processes to propose and implement changes to make them more efficient and reduce risk  Completion of quarterly and year end reporting exhibits in line with timetable  Providing support and help finance teams in other locations  Supporting the Finance Manager and the other accountants in various ad hoc projects  Continual process improvement and efficiencies  Liaise with the accounting teams and Treasury in Europe and the USA to ensure accurate intercompany reporting and timely settlements      Key Skill and Knowledge   Bachelor of Business Administration or Accounting or equivalent  Qualifications like CPA, CA, or CFA is a plus  Languages: Fluent in English and Arabic  Computer Skills: Excel, Word, use of accounting systems and Oracle   Experience of monthly accounting close process in a fast paced environment      Work Experience:   4 to 5 years of experience   
 Key Competencies   US GAAP and IFRS knowledge desirable although not essential  Able to work under pressure and meet key deadlines  Focus on strong control environment and experience of balance sheet reconciliations  Responsible individual used to dealing with people at all levels of the organisation.  Team player who has a hands on approach to achieving objectives with ability to motivate self and others  Results oriented individual with a drive for continuous improvement.  Flexibility with the ability to prioritise work to ensure tight deadlines are met  Strong communication skills, both written and verbal  Attention to detail

column7:
Job Description

Position : INSPECTOR

Organization 
 Function : Technical Country : Lebanon Location : Nahr Ibrahim Supervisor : Quality First Line Manager 

Context

Quality control inspectors examine products and materials for defects or deviations from specifications.

Purpose 
 To ensure that the finished product adheres the quality criteria or meets the requirements of the client or customer 

Areas of responsibility
 As Inspector, you will be in charge of: Performing In-process control during manufacturing. Controlling and inspecting the manufacturing process of the products on all machines and at all stages and performing all the relevant measurements in order to make sure that the products are in conformity with the manufacturing notes. Issuing Rejection Notes “NR” for the non-conforming products explaining the nature of the defects as well as their causes and the suggested actions to be taken and also following up the execution of these decisions as approved by the quality engineer. Controlling the accomplishment of the newly developed products by doing relevant measurements and writing reports to summarize the results of the projects and the “OD” as well as suggesting any improvement or modification which will help in manufacturing quality products efficiently. Following the raw material testing during production, verifying their compliance with the specifications and summarizing all the results in written reports contributing in the qualification of raw materials. Performing dimensional testing for the finished products (LV, MV, HV and telephone cables) in the absence of the lab testers. Accomplishing immediate actions during production (e.g.: reducing thicknesses of sheaths and insulation, etc…) or executing official corrective actions in order to reduce the raw material consumption. Performing any other duties assigned by his direct Supervisor / Manager. Keeping self well-presented and observing standards and behaviours that enhance the company image  test, or measure materials or products being produced Remove all products and materials that fail to meet specifications Discuss inspection results with those responsible for products Report inspection and test data 

Expected results

To reduce and prevent defects or malfunctioning of the product

Required Skills And Qualifications
 Good oral and written skills in French/English and ability to communicate effectively Knowledge in computer Numeracy skills – to calibrate and measure specifications Physical strength and stamina – quality control inspectors spend long periods of time standing and may be required to lift heavy objects, so applicants for this role should be physically fit TS electrical or electronic is preferably
column12:
As a global leader in advanced cabling and connectivity solutions, Nexans brings energy to life through an extensive range of best-in-class products and innovative services. For over 120 years, innovation has been the company’s hallmark, enabling Nexans to drive a safer, smarter and more efficient future together with its customers. 

Today, the Nexans Group is committed to facilitating energy transition and supporting the exponential growth of data by empowering its customers in four main business areas: Building & Territories (including utilities, smart grids, e­mobility), High Voltage & Projects (covering offshore wind farms, submarine interconnections, land high voltage), Telecom & Data (covering data transmission, telecom networks, hyperscale data centers, LAN), and Industry & Solutions (including renewables, transportation, Oil & Gas, automation, and others). 

Corporate Social Responsibility is a guiding principle of Nexans’ business activities and internal practices. In 2013 Nexans became the first cable provider to create a Foundation supporting sustainable initiatives bringing access to energy to disadvantaged communities worldwide. The Group’s commitment to developing ethical, sustainable and high-quality cables drives its active involvement within several leading industry associations, including Europacable, The National Electrical Manufacturers Association (NEMA), International Cablemakers Federation (ICF) or CIGRE to mention a few. 

Nexans employs more than 26,000 people with industrial footprint in 34 countries and commercial activities worldwide. In 2017, the Group generated 6.4 billion euros in sales. Nexans is listed on Euronext Paris, compartment A.

Job Description
 Maintain an accurate, complete, up-to-date and insightful client business profiles to be shared with senior management. Drive client satisfaction by providing insights and actionable recommendations during presentations or business reviews and also by providing value-added analyses and response
to special requests.
 Undertake sales activities independently or in conjunction with senior staff in terms of preparation and delivery of proposal and credentials. Ensure the generation of required revenue from the assigned client portfolio and proper contract costing in order to meet the agreed budget targets. Identify and recommend enhanced and new services that answer clients' business needs. Build and maintain ongoing relationships with the identified key persons within client organization.
Knowledge And Skills Required
 Strong Client Focus Understand marketing enough to hold meaningful conversations with client’s marketing &
business teams.
 Knowledge of statistics and multivariate analysis Expert knowledge of research techniques and methodologies Proactive Able to influence and persuade. Strong customer service and interpersonal communication skills Ability to analyse and interpret data in a challenging and insightful manner Efficient time management, ability to multi-task and detail oriented Displays maturity and creative problem solving skills in handling crises Recommend improvements in work processes within area of responsibility Analyses and interprets financial information to ensure achievement of business targets and
early identification of issues / crisis.
 Able to operate in a multi-cultural environment
Qualifications
 4 to 6 years’ experience and Proven success with primary research. Post-Graduation from a premier institute. Good analysis skills and insight generation. Good grounding in custom research principles, methodologies, statistical techniques. Basic business understanding (e.g. comfortable with terminology: revenue, profit, loss, margin). Excellent PowerPoint and Excel skills or Google Slides and Google Sheets.
Nielsen Holdings plc (NYSE: NLSN) is a global performance management company that provides a comprehensive understanding of what consumers watch and buy. Nielsen’s Watch segment provides media and advertising clients with Nielsen Total Audience measurement services for all devices on which content — video, audio and text — is consumed. The Buy segment offers consumer packaged goods manufacturers and retailers the industry’s only global view of retail performance measurement. By integrating information from its Watch and Buy segments and other data sources, Nielsen also provides its clients with analytics that help improve performance. Nielsen, an S&P 500 company, has operations in over 100 countries, covering more than 90% of the world’s population. For more information, visit www.nielsen.com.

The purpose of the Ethiopia Electronic Health Information System (e-HIS) project is to support the Federal Ministry of Health (FMOH) in strengthening and modernizing the national Health Information System of Ethiopia. The project will involve supporting the government of Ethiopia to develop and bring to scale priority electronic health information systems, instill a culture of data use, build capacity and governance for the improved HIS, and ensure integrated systems by fostering stakeholder collaboration.

QED is seeking a Knowledge Management & Communications Specialist for an anticipated USAID Ethiopia Health Information Systems (HIS) project. The expected purpose of the project is to improve the collection and use of high-quality routine information in the health sector and contribute to improved quality, efficiency and availability of primary health and nutrition services at all levels. He/She will be responsible for the leadership and in-country management of the project’s monitoring, evaluation and learning activities.

Work with technical staff across the project’s office to promote knowledge capture, dissemination, and utilization to promote program cohesion and internal/external communicationProvide Chief of Party with regular program updates and summaries on program successes for a wide audienceRecommend to the MEL Advisor best approaches to showcase program impact to USAID, local counterparts and the publicWork with MEL Advisor to capture and feature program successes in innovative and compelling waysWork with MEL Advisor and DCOP to draft regular program updates for USAID reporting (quarterly and annual reports)Train technical staff (as needed) on KM best practice and story-tellingResponsible for updating all communications tools and products (program brochures, newsletters, success stories, website, and social media platforms)Bachelor’s Degree in communications, knowledge management, international development, or relevant field.5-7 years of experience in designing, leading, and implementing KM Communication activities on complex development programs (USAID-funded preferred)3-5 years of experience with HMIS and medical/health data/indicatorsAbility to work and quickly adapt in a complex environmentAbility to respond to pressure and deliver quality products on-timeStrong communications and data visualization skillsDemonstrated experience using communications tools to demonstrate impactExcellent oral and written communication skillsStrong training, communications and personnel management skillsEthiopian national strongly preferredFluency in English is required; Fluency in Amharic is preferred

column12:
QED Group works globally with the public and private sectors to improve their performance and manage results. Using a systems approach, we combine innovative and evidence-based solutions with organizational development to drive efficiencies. 

Leveraging our proven experience and unique capabilities, we make complex data insightful and actionable. We are experts in monitoring, evaluating, assessing and training across sectors, such as health, security, agriculture, economic growth, governance, and education.

QED offers uniquely integrated solutions in Monitoring and Evaluation , Assessment, Global Health Solutions, Sustainable Investing, Organizational Development, and Innovation & Data. We have worked in more than 95 countries, using an evidence-based and multi-disciplinary approach to help advance global development impact. Currently, we are operating in 43 countries.

Our key clients are:

- The United States Agency for International Development (USAID)
- The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)
- The U.S. Department of State (DOS)
- UK Department for International Development (DFID)
- The U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA)
- Organization of American States (OAS)
- United States Institute of Peace

column7: As a Technical Leader, you are responsible for developing frameworks, tools, methods, and solutions to advance and support practice area growth within your field of expertise. You are recognized as the subject matter expert both internally and with customers developing complex ITO technical solutions as part of an overall solution framework and engagement team. This role will translate client needs into specific technical requirements that are agreed upon contractually and with the line of business members ultimately responsible for operating them.   Requirements:   B.S. or M.S. degree in Computer Science with a minimum of 3 years of experience Experience in J2EE, Java programming, SOA Design patterns for building middleware systems and Messaging. Experience with API driven architecture and microservices. Development experience of SOAP and Restful Web Services, XML and JSON. Strong knowledge in applying patterns while designing such as Object Oriented, Integration, and application design patterns. Knowledge of development and build framework such as Spring, JPA/Hibernate, Maven and Struts. Experience in UML diagrams. Knowledge of Data Modeling. Good communication and interpersonal skills

Description

To effectively represent and promote Boehringer Ingelheim (BI) core products to existing and potential customers, by presenting how BI products benefits their patients, with the objective of maximizing sales revenue and increasing market share, also To offer innovative, tailored solutions for key accounts ensuring long term presence of the Specialty portfolio whilst adhering to best practice principles and BI's standard operational procedures (SOPs).

Responsibilities
  Builds and executes an effective Sales Action Plan with the objective of maximizing BI business in assigned accounts and to ensure achievement of sales and market share targets/objectives   Monitors the sales development and performance of BI Specialty products.   Plans and schedules daily visits with existing and potential customers to deliver BI’s assigned core product message   Records and tracks product sales and customers in his/her region   Obtains and records feedback from existing customer on competitors product performance and monitors their activity   Secures consistent and sustainable growth in sales and revenue by identifying and developing new market opportunities.   Precise & full understanding and utilization of medical knowledge about therapeutic area and related products.   Obtain and provide information about the development in accounts on their purchasing medicines and developments regarding to healthcare projects.   Listing of Specialty products in all accounts through the value proposition of Specialty products to the payers and P&T committee and the decision makers.   Set the optimum price per account, through direct bonus or any other alternative price strategy, to ensure listing BI oncology portfolio within the accounts.   Monitor the competition intelligence activities on Key Accounts.   Achieve or exceed overall sales targets via appropriate resource utilization as well as routine and frequent visits to key stakeholders as chief pharmacists; decision makers; and related physicians   Update a OTSW analysis to be translated in to quantitative and qualitative objective for the assigned accounts.   Build strong and long partnership with all Key stakeholders and Ensure their full awareness of BI product benefits to the patients.   Propose customized partnership programs for both prescriber and payers that needs to build the productive business relation between the account and BI. 

Requirements
  Bachelor's degree in Pharmacy.   Based in Lebanon.   Minimum 3 to 4 years of Pharmaceutical Sales experience.   Respiratory or Oncology experience is a must.   Profound communication and Presentation skills.   Language skills: Fluency in English.

Sales

Africa, Asia, Australasia-LB-Beirut-Beirut

Organization

EG-Boehringer Ingelheim Egypt

We are proud of addressing some of the most challenging healthcare issues. Our vision – value through innovation – has always characterized our collaborative work, and is for us simultaneously a fundamental requirement and a driving force. Headquartered in Ingelheim, Germany, Boehringer Ingelheim employs more than 50,000 employees. For more information please visit www.boehringer-ingelheim.com

column7:
Job Description

 Company Overview 

As part of our continued growth, SAS Middle East are hiring for a Regional Senior Account Executive with strong technology solutions sales experience in the Middle East and/or Levant region.

Based from Lebanon, you will sell to customers and manage accounts across multiple industries in a regional territory that will include Lebanon, Jordan, Qatar and Kuwait.

Key Responsibilities
Generate sales for software, solutions and services into prospective customers & build strong pipeline.Work with other sales leaders to position and leverage sales opportunities to acquire, grow and retain customers within assigned territory.Fulfill wide range of requests for information from prospective customers. Qualifies level of opportunity and type of account.Prospect within a territory or account to uncover business needs.Implement aspects of territory and account management and development; identifies accounts with high "close" potential, qualifies, and forecast time frames to close business.Prepare standard quotations and proposal information as needed; works with other departments to create and finalize contracts and set time schedules for services.Follow up with customers to track satisfaction levels and to discover additional revenue opportunities.Develop a basic understanding of company pricing and licensing procedures.Plan and implements growth plans, including sales, consulting services, and education services.Responsible for achievement of Total Software Revenue Target (and services)Coordinate resources from sales and services staff for solution selling and promotes and reinforces Solutions Selling and Miller-Heiman concepts. Work in conjunction with the Strategic Pricing Group to negotiate contracts and bids.Directs complex sales opportunities, including implementation plans, which include the coordination of internal and/or external professional services.Deliver timely and accurate sales forecasts to management.

Experience Required

The position ideally suits somebody with 10+ years’ experience selling complex technology solutions (including software) to organizations in the Middle East and/or Levant region. You should have proven success selling to business functions (not just IT) and building and managing relationships with contacts up to C-Suite level.

Due to the geographic territory you will be required to travel extensively to meet with customers.

About SAS

SAS believes in the whole employee experience. Meaningful work. Empowerment to make a difference that changes people’s lives. Dynamic work environments that foster innovation. And an award-winning culture that makes it all possible. We believe great ideas can come from anywhere. Whether you're a university recruit, or an experienced professional ready for the next big challenge, SAS brings perks, passion, and the potential to grow. No limits.

Want to stay up to date on SAS culture, products and jobs? Follow us on LinkedIn

column7:
Job Description

Position : Operator

Organization 
 Function : Production Country : Lebanon Location : Nahr Ibrahim Supervisor : First Line Production Manager 

Context 

The Operator ensures the production in line with objectives in quantity, quality and deadlines. He applies the safety and environment standards within his workplace.

Purpose 
 To improve the production and satisfy the customer 

Areas of responsibility

Conduct of production machines

Knows areas of risk.Checks the safety operation on the machine.Starts and stops the machine according to the standards.Performs checks before starting the production.Meets the OPL instructions.

Monitoring of production

Reads, understands and carries out work instructions.Sets up for new production batch. Drives production respecting operating procedures in term of costs,

quality and deadlines.

Performs quality check on the products.

Monitoring of performance

 Monitors the productivity: records production results and checks

the conformance to productivity standards.

 Fills in reports and any events useful for traceability: OPI, Quality indicators.Reports daily production on his perimeter.

Application of standards

Respects safety standards.Respects OPL instructions.Knows and understands standards in his perimeter.Alerts on failures, risks and problems on his perimeter.Reports non-conformities and breakdowns.

Continuous improvement

Identifies problems on his perimeter.Participates in continuous improvement workgroup

Expected results

The Operator ensures the production in line with objectives in quantity, quality and deadlines. He applies the safety and environment standards within his workplace.

Required Skills And Qualifications
 Commits to the team. Shows respect for his colleagues work. Ensures mutual aid with his colleagues. Gives the production instructions for the next shift. Operational excellence Take responsibility Global team player Application of standard

column12:
As a leading international franchise operator, with nearly 90 of the world’s most recognised brands in its portfolio, Alshaya Group brings great shopping, dining, leisure and hospitality experiences to millions of customers across the Middle East & North Africa, Russia, Turkey, Europe and beyond. 

Alshaya Group is a dynamic multinational business and family owned enterprise with a consistent record of growth and innovation. For 35 years, Alshaya has been a pioneering force in brand franchising, using its exceptional knowledge and experience to expand at pace.

Our portfolio of well-loved international brands includes Starbucks, H&M, Mothercare, Debenhams, American Eagle Outfitters, P.F. Chang’s, The Cheesecake Factory, The Body Shop, M.A.C, Victoria’s Secret, Boots, Pottery Barn, KidZania and, coming soon, Hampton by Hilton.

From one retail franchise store opened in Kuwait in 1983, Alshaya Group has consistently grown and diversified and today offers customers an unparalleled choice of brands across multiple sectors; Fashion & Footwear, Health & Beauty, Food, Optics, Pharmacy, Home Furnishings, Leisure & Entertainment, and Hotels. A diverse, skilled team of 53,000 people from 120 nationalities support more than 4,000 stores, cafes, restaurants and leisure destinations, a growing online business and a commitment to delivering great customer experiences.
